title: What's News --  World-Wide
text:
Jordan's government accused a younger half-brother of the country's reigning monarch of plotting to destabilize the kingdom, as a rift within the royal family threatened to upend politics in the critical U.S. Middle Eastern ally.

---

J&J is taking over manufacturing of its Covid-19 vaccine at a contract manufacturer's plant that makes the main ingredient, after a production problem ruined a batch.

---

Some Democrats are cool to Biden's proposed tax increases on corporations as part of a $2.3 trillion infrastructure plan.

---

New York Gov. Cuomo and state lawmakers are nearing a budget agreement that would increase corporate and income taxes by $4.3 billion a year.

---

Authorities have made sharply fewer arrests and deportations of immigrants in the U.S. illegally since Biden took office.

---

The Chinese-American community in Atlanta held a memorial and interment for Daoyou Feng, a victim of last month's spa shootings.

---

Hong Kong's government is seeking to limit public access to details in company records that identify owners and directors.
